472 Maoist surrendered this year, highest in 3 years: Govt

description: In brutal attacks on women from the poor strata, a ragpicker and a beggar were found murdered after rape in two different incidents in the city today, police said.

description: PMK chief S Ramadoss says there is no proper treatment for cirrhosis and it is primarily caused by continuous drinking of alcohol.

description: Previously, the SC adopted a cautious approach by asking the Centre to file details of the decision-making process in sealed cover with the Secretary General of the SC and not with the registry. description: The RSS wants the government to legislate on the Ram temple issue. The Sangh is of the view that the Centre should acquire the Ayodhya land and hand it over for construction of the temple. “The government should follow the example of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel who cleared the decks for the reconstruction of the Somnath temple in Gujarat,” RSS said.

description: Thousands of tweets hit Twitter under the hashtag #pornban, with users saying this goes against net neutrality laws in India, which prohibit discrimination against any content provider. Users feel the government should have taken strong action against child porn and rape porn, and not against the more well-known porn websites.

description: ‘Dynamic pricing’ will be scrapped for 15 trains and suspended for the 'lean months' of February, March and August for 32 others. The new plan also lowers the ceiling for dynamic pricing to 1.4 times of the last fare for the remaining 101 trains under the scheme and offers up to 20% discount on ‘last-minute’ bookings made up to four days before the journey.

Naidu had last week announced that he will play the role of a “facilitator” for a national-level alliance of opposition parties.

description: The smashed fuselage of a crashed Indonesian Lion Air jetliner may have been found, a top military commander said Wednesday, as Jakarta ordered the removal of the budget carrier's technical director and staff who cleared the doomed flight for take-off.Authorities said they were confident sonar technology had pinpointed the location of the Boeing 737.

But while his friends battled their way through Jakarta's daily congestion to make the flight, Sony found himself stuck on a toll road for hours.

title: Nepal PM's health condition improving, say doctors
description: Nepal Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli's health has improved, said doctors at Manmohan Cardiovascular and Transplant Center, Maharajgunj on Tuesday.Prime Minister Oli, who was rushed to the hospital on Monday after suffering lung infection, will remain admitted in the Intense Care Unit (ICU) for the next few days, the doctor added.

description: Assange spoke from the embassy via teleconference at a hearing in Quito of a lawsuit challenging the Ecuadorean government requiring him to pay for medical bills, phone calls and clean up after his pet cat.

He also suspended parliament in an apparent bid to shore up support for newly appointed Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa.

title: Bangladesh court doubles jail term for opposition leader Khaleda Zia
description: The decision came the day after Khaleda Zia, 73, was ordered jailed for seven years in a separate case, piling pressure on the opposition ahead of a national election.  The increased term was ordered over embezzlement charges for which Zia was sentenced in February.

description: US President Donald Trump and his team is leaving no stone unturned to campaign in favour of his Republican party ahead of the crucial November 6 mid term polls which will decide the balance of powers in the Congress over next two years. Only a week is left for the November 6 mid term elections,

description: The death toll from fierce storms battering Italy has risen to nine, civil protection authorities said Tuesday, as wild weather caused schools to close and trapped dozens of tourists in the north of the country.With ferocious storms lashing the country, winds reached up to 180 kilometres an hour (110 mph) in some areas, toppling trees and causing flooding.

description: The surge has been particularly keen at Asia's budget airlines such as Lion Air, whose Flight 610 disappeared into the sea shortly after takeoff from Jakarta. The Boeing 737 Max 8 carried 189 people and was bound for Pangkal Pinang on a smaller island in the Indonesian archipelago.

description: The right to information (RTI) reply, given by the assistant registrar of companies, on October 3, is in response to a RTI request filed by the investment arms of Shapoorji Pallonji Group on August 31. You may however access the lounge on a paid basis.”

description: "After a volatile start, market sharply rebounded led by clarity over the independence of RBI by the government. Rupee pared some losses while strong global cues and stock specific actions supported the market to remain positive," said Vinod Nair, head of research, Geojit Financial Services Ltd.

title: Core sector growth slows down to 4-month low in Sept
description: Eight infrastructure sectors of coal, crude oil, natural gas, refinery products, fertilisers, steel, cement and electricity had grown by 4.7 per cent in September 2017.

description: On the BSE index, HDFC, IndusInd Bank, Infosys, Yes Bank, Sun Pharma and Axis Bank were among the major gainers with their stocks rising as much as 5.51 per cent. Except for Nifty Metal, all the sub-indices ended in green on the NSE platform, gaining as much as 4.07 per cent.

description: The finance ministry, in a statement, said, "Both the government and the central bank, in their functioning, have to be guided by public interest and the requirements of the Indian economy. description: There has been an irreversible breakdown between the RBI Governor Urjit Patel and the government, the report further stated, adding that all options were on the table.

title: Cognizant banking delivery head quits
description: Deshpande, who joined Cognizant as an architect in 1999, went on to head the BFS product solutions business and incubated it in emerging markets. He was also the delivery head for the infrastructure services business and played a key role in Cognizant’s $2.7-billion acquisition of Trizetto.

title: RBI governor exits finance ministry via side gate
description: Urjit Patel had come to attend a routine meeting of the Financial Stability and Development Council, headed by the finance minister. The exit was carefully planned as Patel took the side gate out of North Block, where his car was waiting for him. But unlike their boss, the deputy governors chose to take the main door, although none of them spoke to reporters.

title: IL&FS likely to sell off a dozen NH projects
description: These projects involved investment of at least Rs 14,000 crore, sources in the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) said. IL&FS representatives said they would soon appoint a professional for valuation of the completed stretches to assess how much they can get from selling these revenue generating projects.

title: SBI halves daily ATM withdrawal limit for certain users
description: The withdrawal limit has been curtailed on Classic and Maestro debit cards, held by a large number of the bank customers. However, customers with other variants of SBI debit card can continue to enjoy higher daily withdrawal from ATMs.

title: Arun Jaitley-led panel discusses NBFC liquidity issues
description: Reserve Bank governor Urjit Patel said the liquidity problem in NBFCs is not as severe as is being projected, but assured the government that it would ensure adequate liquidity in the system, sources said. The government, on its part, asked the RBI to prevent spreading of IL&FS crisis to other sectors of the economy, sources added.

description: A plan to be presented to a bankruptcy court on Wednesday by the state-appointed board of the lender includes selling the entire stake to a financially strong investor and ensure business continuity. title: Centre, states apportion Rs 32k cr IGST in Oct
description: The apportionment would add to the goods and services tax (GST) revenue of both the centre and states for October. The total revenue collection figures for the month would be released on November 1.

description: "The central bank looked the other way when banks gave loans indiscriminately during 2008 to 2014," Arun Jaitley said while speaking at an event in New Delhi.

description: What is unusual about the current standoff is the number of issues it has spilt over to and the length of time it has gone on for. Interest rate, the perpetual point of sparrings, has been overtaken by several other turf wars. Among other issues are dividend payment, February 12 restructuring, regulation of public sector banks, reserves, board appointments etc.

title: ODI tickets worth Rs 52.36 lakh went unsold: Khanna
description: "Tickets worth Rupees 52,36,000 were unsold. Why all the tickets were not sold-out? DDCA started online ticket sale quite late that too without proper advertisement," Khanna claimed in a media release.

title: Axar Patel breaks into top-10 ODI bowlers
description: Axar Patel has become the highest placed India bowler in the latest ICC ODI rankings after breaking into the top-10 bowler's list while legspinner Amit Mishra has vaulted 25 places to enter the top-20.

title: India ODI series report card: Kohli, Mishra and then some
description: TOI Sports runs the rule over the performers for India during their 3-2 ODI series win over New Zealand. A report card on the players who featured in India's first ODI series win at home in two years, over NZ across five matches.

title: Wasn't easy sitting out of Test matches: Mishra
description: Mishra didn't mince words when asked about the frustration of having to sit out, but added that coach Anil Kumble's tips had helped him tide over the low phase.

title: 5th ODI: Mishra five-for spins India to series win
description: Amit Mishra finished with 5/18, his second ODI five-wicket haul as India beat New Zealand by a whopping 190 runs at Visakhapatnam to clinch the five match ODI series 3-2. Mishra was named both Man of the Match and the Player of the series.

title: Dhoni describes bowlers performance as one of the best
description: Dhoni lavished praise on his bowlers for the resounding series-clinching win over New Zealand in the fifth and final ODI, describing the effort as "one of the best performances by the bowlers".

title: Kumble's support during lean phase helped me: Mishra
description: "His (Anil Kumble) mental support is the biggest thing for me. I sat out for the entire Test series but he supported me mentally and told me "don't worry, your time will come"," leg-spinner Amit Mishra said.

title: Our batting today was frustrating: Williamson
description: Bruised and battered by India after being bundled out for a meagre 79 while chasing 270 in the series-deciding fifth and final ODI, New Zealand skipper Kane Williamson today termed the performance of his batting department as "frustrating".

title: Vizag ODI: India seek festive cheer
description: The New Zealanders, after being thrashed in the three-match Test series, were expected to put up a much improved show in the One-dayers – a format which they have done well in over the years.

title: Dhoni slogs it out ahead of series decider
description: Dhoni faced the conventional white ball and practised his trademark shots in a lengthy session at the nets. The series poised at 2-2, Rohit Sharma, Ajinkya Rahane and Virat Kohli stayed away from the nets.

title: We would like to do what no other NZ side has done: Southee
description: "I think the guys are pretty excited to do what no other NZ side has ever done before - come over here and win a one-day series. The excitement in the group is very high," Tim Southee said on the eve of the series decider.

title: Want to successfully overcome challenges thrown at me: Jadhav
description: ​​Jadhav, who's playing in place of an indisposed Suresh Raina, bowled for the first time in international cricket when MS Dhoni gave him the ball ahead of the regular spin duo of Axar Patel and Amit Mishra on a seaming Dharamsala track in the first one-dayer.

title: For MS Dhoni, a final return to where his legend began?
description: After scores of 0, 12, 7* and 3, MS Dhoni was sent up the order to No. 3 against Pakistan and proceed to smash 148 off 123 balls with 15 fours and four sixes, setting the platform for India's 356/9 at Visakhapatnam in April 2005.

title: Under-fire Dhoni faces tricky Kiwis test in series-decider
description: With conditions overcast, the last thing India would want is a wash-out. Despite weakening, cyclone Kyant, there's forecast of localised downpours as both the teams will keep their fingers crossed.

title: Dhoni needs strong support cast to rediscover finishing touch
description: "Batting down the order is one of the toughest things to do. You don't get a (ready-made) player who's complete, who bats at No.5, 6 or 7, all the time," skipper MS Dhoni said.

title: Dhoni should stick to batting at No 4: Ganguly
description: Sourav Ganguly insisted that Mahendra Singh Dhoni should stick to batting at No 4 which will enable him and Virat Kohli could play the finishers' role. The former Indian captain however said India were not becoming too much over dependent on Kohli.

title: We are geared up for the series decider: Taylor
description: Eyeing a historic bilateral ODI series win in India, New Zealand batsman Ross Taylor said they are hungry to win the five-match series decider on Saturday and make up for the 0-3 whitewash in Tests. "You don't often win series away from home especially in the sub-continent," Taylor said.

title: 4th ODI: Job of a finisher is one of the toughest, says Dhoni
description: India's limited overs skipper Mahendra Singh Dhoni has said that the job of a finisher is one of the toughest and it is difficult to find a 'complete' player who is adept at batting in lower order and take the team through when the chips are down.

description: Going into the fifth and final ODI, India lead the series 2-1. Historically, West Indies haven't beaten India in an ODI series since 2006. More damning, they haven't won two matches in a series against India after 2011.

title: Rusty Bhuvneshwar India’s only worry: Gavaskar
description: In the fourth ODI, India showed that Virat Kohli can fail occasionally and still the team can rack up a massive total. The only worry is Bhuvaneshwar Kumar and he is looking undercooked at the moment. The more he bowls the better it will be, Gavaskar wrote.

title: Asian Champions Trophy: India calls out Pakistan's 'blatant lie'
description: They lifted the Asian Champions Trophy jointly but India and Pakistan were on Wednesday locked in a war of words over how the decision was reached to abandon the final after a thunderstorm and heavy showers in Muscat.

title: Yo-yo test is here to stay: Bharat Arun
description: The yo-yo test has been the Indian team management's pet project. The aerobic endurance test, which functions as a primary screening mechanism to pick players to the national side, has been under fire from many questioning whether it is overruling a cricketer's ability, form and mental fortitude.

title: Accidental captain Holder holding WI together
description: Captaincy just fell on Holder after West Indies' tumultuous tour to India in 2014 that saw the players, including then captain Dwayne Bravo, rebel against the cricket board and leave the tour midway citing contractual disputes.

description: Santiago Solari got off to the perfect start as Real Madrid's interim coach when his side thrashed Melilla 4-0 in the Copa del Rey on Wednesday.
